dxf2svg.util
Class SvgUtil

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.util.SvgUtil
public final class SvgUtil
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides various utilities and conversions methods. It also provides controls sizing of Svg output files by determining screen size and optimum page sizing in the default view.

Version:
2.0 - April 20, 2005
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Constructor Detail

SvgUtil

public SvgUtil(double minX,
               double minY,
               double maxX,
               double maxY,
               double scale)
The constructor calculates the target User Units (the default measure unit in Svg) by querying the current screen resolution (default) or, alternatively, by making the appropriate calculations based on the -s switch value. The end result will size an 8.75 inch illustration to fit within a default Internet Explorer window with a high degree of accuracy.

Parameters:
minX - Minimum x value of the drawing's limits.
minY - Minimum y value of the drawing's limits.
maxX - Minimum x value of the drawing's limits.
maxY - Minimum y value of the drawing's limits.
scale - Line type scale.
Method Detail

isWithinLimitsFrame

public boolean isWithinLimitsFrame(double x,
                                   double y)
This method tests if the argument point is within the frame designated by the DXF's limits.

Returns:
true if the point is within or on the frame and false if outside the limits frame.

getLimits

public LimitsFrame getLimits()
Returns the rectangular frame that outlines the frame that describes the Dxf's limits.

getMaximumHTMLViewportHeight

public final int getMaximumHTMLViewportHeight()
Returns the maximum height of the viewport that will allow the drawing to viewed and the English / French button to appear properly when the browser is maximized. This value is used to specify the height attribute of the <EMBED> tag in HTML.

getMaximumHTMLViewportWidth

public final int getMaximumHTMLViewportWidth()
Returns the maximum width of the viewport that will allow the drawing to viewed and the English / French button to appear properly when the browser is maximized. This value is used to specify the height attribute of the <EMBED> tag in HTML.

trimDouble

public double trimDouble(double DNum)
Trims double values to user specified number of digit precision.

Parameters:
DNum - number you wish to trim.
Returns:
double Trimmed value as double.

trimDouble

public double trimDouble(double DNum,
                         int P)
Used to trim numbers to an arbitrary precision despite what was set at runtime with the -p switch. Used for increasing precision of angles for trigonometric calculations.

Parameters:
DNum - Number to trim as a double
P - as an integer of the number of digits precision.
Returns:
double vale trimmed to P digits.

Units

public final double Units()
Returns the value of USR_UNITS (pixels per inch). interface.

Returns:
double USR_UNITS

pointsPerPixel

public final double pointsPerPixel()
Returns the points per pixel for the user defined screen resolution.

convertXToSvgSpace

public double convertXToSvgSpace(double x)
This method converts an x value to Svg space. Essentially this method makes the convertion the x value to pixels as there is no other transformation for the x coordinate from DXF space.

convertYToSvgSpace

public double convertYToSvgSpace(double yVal)
Converts DXF 'y' values into SVG equivalents. This is required because DXF space numbers its 'y' coordinates starting with 0 at the bottom of the image and SVG enumerates its 'y' values starting with 0 from the top of the page. X values are handled the same way in both file formats.

Parameters:
yVal - value you want to flip on axis into SVG space.
Returns:
double Converted value.

flipCoordinateSpace

public void flipCoordinateSpace(Point p)
This method will flip a point from one space to another. This is required for classes that perform calculations in DXF space and then need to flip into SVG space. It should be noted that there is an assumtion that both x and y values of the argument point are in USR_UNITS.

See Also:
SvgEllipse.getElementAsPath(boolean)

convertYToDxfSpace

public double convertYToDxfSpace(double yVal)
Converts SVG y value of a Point back to the equivelant DXF y value. This is essentially the reverse of convertYToSvgSpace(double) with the exception that the returned value remains in USR_UNITS (pixels) not the original Inches or MM.
There is no convertXToDxfSpace() method because there is no X transformation from DXF space to SVG space.

deltaDxfSvgLimitsX

public double deltaDxfSvgLimitsX()
Returns the delta between the DXF origin which could be arbitrary and the SVG origin which is always 0,0.

Returns:
double The delta between the X values in these files.

deltaDxfSvgLimitsY

public double deltaDxfSvgLimitsY()
Returns the delta between the DXF origin which could be arbitrary and the SVG origin which is always 0,0.

Returns:
double The delta between the Y values in these files.

replaceCharacterEntities

public static java.lang.String replaceCharacterEntities(java.lang.String s)
Replaces characters with their equivalent character entities.

Parameters:
s - the string input to replace characters in
Returns:
String with values replaced.

isWithinTolerance

public static boolean isWithinTolerance(double test,
                                        double norm,
                                        double fuzz)
This function simply reports whether a supplied test value is within range of (+-) the supplied fuzz value.

Parameters:
test - Value to be tested for tolerances.
norm - The value to be measured against.
fuzz - The acceptable tolerance as a percentage. 3.5 is 3 1/2 percent.
Returns:
true if test is within tolerances; false otherwise.

getLtScale

public double getLtScale()
Returns the line type scale state from the DXF being converted.

public double getLimitsMaxX()
Returns the maximum X value of the limits frame.

public double getLimitsMinX()
Returns the minimum X value of the limits frame.

public double getLimitsMaxY()
Returns the maximum Y value of the limits frame.

getLimitsMinY

public double getLimitsMinY()
Returns the minimum Y value of the limits frame.
